theorem P3_iff_exists_open_subset_closure_eq_closure
    {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A : Set X} :
    Topology.P3 (A : Set X) ↔
      ∃ U : Set X, IsOpen U ∧ (A : Set X) ⊆ U ∧ closure U = closure A := by
  classical
  constructor
  · intro hP3
    -- Choose `U = interior (closure A)`.
    refine
      ⟨interior (closure (A : Set X)), isOpen_interior, ?_, ?_⟩
    · -- `A ⊆ U`
      simpa using hP3
    · -- `closure U = closure A`
      have h₁ :
          closure (interior (closure (A : Set X))) ⊆ closure A :=
        closure_mono
          (interior_subset :
            interior (closure (A : Set X)) ⊆ closure A)
      have h₂ :
          closure A ⊆ closure (interior (closure (A : Set X))) := by
        -- Since `A ⊆ interior (closure A)`, taking closures yields the inclusion.
        have : (A : Set X) ⊆ interior (closure (A : Set X)) := hP3
        exact closure_mono this
      exact Set.Subset.antisymm h₁ h₂
  · rintro ⟨U, hOpenU, hASubU, hClosureEq⟩
    -- From the hypotheses, show `A ⊆ interior (closure A)`.
    dsimp [Topology.P3]
    have hU_to_int :
        U ⊆ interior (closure U) :=
      interior_maximal subset_closure hOpenU
    have hIntEq :
        interior (closure U) = interior (closure (A : Set X)) := by
      simpa [hClosureEq] using rfl
    intro x hxA
    have : x ∈ U := hASubU hxA
    have : x ∈ interior (closure U) := hU_to_int this
    simpa [hIntEq] using this

```lean
import Mathlib
import Aesop

namespace Topology

variable {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X]

/-- Property `P₁`: every point of `A` is adherent to `interior A`. -/
def P1 (A : Set X) : Prop :=
  A ⊆ closure (interior A)

/-- Property `P₂`: every point of `A` belongs to the interior of the closure of
`interior A`. -/
def P2 (A : Set X) : Prop :=
  A ⊆ interior (closure (interior A))

/-- Property `P₃`: every point of `A` belongs to the interior of `closure A`. -/
def P3 (A : Set X) : Prop :=
  A ⊆ interior (closure A)

/-- `P₂ A` implies `P₁ A`. -/
theorem P2_implies_P1 {A : Set X} : P2 (A : Set X) → P1 A := by
  intro hA
  dsimp [P2] at hA
  dsimp [P1] at *
  exact hA.trans interior_subset

/-- **Corrected**: `P₂ A` implies `P₃ A`. -/
theorem P2_implies_P3 {A : Set X} : P2 (A : Set X) → P3 A := by
  intro hA
  dsimp [P2, P3] at *
  -- We need `interior (closure (interior A)) ⊆ interior (closure A)`.
  have hIncl :
      interior (closure (interior (A : Set X))) ⊆
        interior (closure A) :=
    interior_mono
      (closure_mono
        (interior_subset : interior (A : Set X) ⊆ A))
  exact hA.trans hIncl

end Topology
```

theorem P1_implies_subset_closure_interior_closure
    {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A : Set X} :
    Topology.P1 (A : Set X) → (A ⊆ closure (interior (closure A))) := by
  intro hP1
  dsimp [Topology.P1] at hP1
  intro x hxA
  -- From `P1`, we have `x ∈ closure (interior A)`.
  have hx_cl : x ∈ closure (interior (A : Set X)) := hP1 hxA
  -- Monotonicity of `interior` lifts `A ⊆ closure A`.
  have hIncl :
      closure (interior (A : Set X)) ⊆
        closure (interior (closure (A : Set X))) := by
    apply closure_mono
    apply interior_mono
    exact (subset_closure : (A : Set X) ⊆ closure A)
  exact hIncl hx_cl
